remarks: An element is zero iff its product with a nonzero element is zero. (Contributed by NM, 8-Oct-2014.)
statement:
drngmuleq0.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
drngmuleq0.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
drngmuleq0.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
drngmuleq0.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. DivRing ) $.
drngmuleq0.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
drngmuleq0.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
drngmuleq0.e $e |- ( ph -> Y =/= .0. ) $.
drngmuleq0 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( X .x. Y ) = .0. <-> X = .0. ) ) $.
